article.title: A Model of Optimal Network Structure for Decentralized Nearest Neighbor Search

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1 shows the optimal graph structures for a 4x4 regular lattice found using a branch and bound algorithm. What is the main difference between these structures?
choices: The number of edges in each structure.
The specific arrangement of edges in each structure.
The type of regular lattice used to generate the structures.
The distance function used to calculate the objective value.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figures 2, 3, and 4 present solutions found using a heuristic approach for regular lattices of size 5x5, 6x6, and 7x7, respectively. What trend can be observed in the objective function (f) values as the lattice size increases?
choices: The objective function values remain constant.
There is no observable trend in the objective function values.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the indicator variable  *y<sub>ij</sub><sup>k</sup>*  in the mathematical programming model?
choices: To represent if an edge (i, j) exists in the optimal graph.
To indicate if vertex k belongs to the shortest path between vertices i and j.
To determine the distance between vertex k and the query q.
To track if vertex k is visited during the greedy walk from vertex i to vertex j.
